item.title: Runescape 3
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:69, topic:509363”]I think the fact that they were going to call their second big game ‘Mechscape’ speaks volumes as to just how little creative talent they have. They couldn’t even come up with an interesting name for it.

As mentioned above, even other game development teams at Jagex are encouraged to ‘be more like Runescape’. Mechscape was probably dumped for being same shit, different name (essentially).
You guys are free to disagree. Time will tell (but I think their waning player base is telling enough).[/quote]It was renamed Stellar Dawn at the start of development.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape 3
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:73, topic:509363”]One of the reasons they moved to HTML5 was for more device support. They want to future-proof the game more or less and allow it to be played on portable devices before other free-to-play MMOs do so (I assume, I know they want the device support though).

In regards to EoC being shit or worse than the previous combat system, that’s total bullshit. If I were a new player, I would totally enjoy the EoC combat system a lot more than the previous one. Even now, after playing with it for a few hours, it’s a lot more enjoyable and requires at least a bit of tactics and is just a lot more engaging over all.

Lothy:

At the end of the day, this means that it’s a kids game as far as competitive play goes… Oh, and adults like myself who started playing a decade ago. Even for kids though, there probably aren’t enough hours in the day to get the best equipment and maxed skills.[/quote]That’s a good thing. Why would I keep playing an MMORPG if I can just finish all the content in a matter of a few months or so? The idea behind a lot of MMORPGs is to make them almost impossible to finish so you play for long periods of time and always get to strive for something you can’t reach yet. This isn’t a single player game meant to be beaten in a few sittings.

100% agree.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape 3
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

One of the reasons they moved to HTML5 was for more device support. They want to future-proof the game more or less and allow it to be played on portable devices before other free-to-play MMOs do so (I assume, I know they want the device support though).

In regards to EoC being shit or worse than the previous combat system, that’s total bullshit. If I were a new player, I would totally enjoy the EoC combat system a lot more than the previous one. Even now, after playing with it for a few hours, it’s a lot more enjoyable and requires at least a bit of tactics and is just a lot more engaging over all.

At the end of the day, this means that it's a kids game as far as competitive play goes... Oh, and adults like myself who started playing a decade ago. Even for kids though, there probably aren't enough hours in the day to get the best equipment and maxed skills.
That's a good thing. Why would I keep playing an MMORPG if I can just finish all the content in a matter of a few months or so? The idea behind a lot of MMORPGs is to make them almost impossible to finish so you play for long periods of time and always get to strive for something you can't reach yet. This isn't a single player game meant to be beaten in a few sittings.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape 3
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I don’t think we’re arguing that RS isn’t dying (at least I’m not), I’m talking solely about the future of RuneScape as it is. Whether or not Jagex needs to make a new game I think is arbitrary to how good this update is, which is probably where the argument started. I agree that they should branch out, and I agree that RS is dying due to past updates, but if you were saying this is a bad update for RuneScape itself, that’s where I disagree. I think it looks pretty good. It’s not EoC-esque in that the community thinks it’s horrible and will ruin the game. Those changes were already made, which is why it’s dying anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape 3
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I think the fact that they were going to call their second big game ‘Mechscape’ speaks volumes as to just how little creative talent they have. They couldn’t even come up with an interesting name for it.

As mentioned above, even other game development teams at Jagex are encouraged to ‘be more like Runescape’. Mechscape was probably dumped for being same shit, different name (essentially).
You guys are free to disagree. Time will tell (but I think their waning player base is telling enough).

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape 3
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Lothy:

I didn’t say they should quit either. As a company, their future is going to be in some other game. They could put Runescape into maintenance mode with intermittent updates and then work on something fresh.

because mechscape, funorb, and the others had all been successful :). to be fair arcanists was a great game and they fucked themselves over by not marketing funorb better.

The move to HTML5 does open them up to be a mmorpg on tablet, depending if it actually plays well or not on them. if it does work it could be a huge draw.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape 3
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I didn’t say they should quit either. As a company, their future is going to be in some other game. They could put Runescape into maintenance mode with intermittent updates and then work on something fresh.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape 3
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I don’t think dying is a reason to call it quits, if you’re still making money. I don’t really see anything wrong with this RuneScape 3 update, it’s not like the EoC where you are drastically changing gameplay forcibly onto people, it’s purely a graphics update (which lets face it, has already been changed and wont be going back) and customizable update. I don’t see what part of the current playerbase would think that’s a bad thing, unlike EoC. Not a current player though, I did quit once the EoC hit. I don’t think it really surprises anyone that the game is dying since the EoC hit, the number of people that said that was a bad call was tremendous (and MMG said he regretted the change if I remember correctly). But I don’t think this will make it worse.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape 3
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I’m not asking them to change their game – I’m calling them stupid for having already done so.
You’ve overlooked the nature of gameplay (which I’ve called slow-paced) and dismissed that in favour of some extra animations. Slow clap for you.

I guess we’ll know if I’m right sooner or later. After all, with a maximum of 50k players online at a time (far fewer than Jagex’s glory days) how long do you really think they can continue to operate?

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape 3
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:63, topic:509363”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=627611.msg4272236#msg4272236 date=1364621873]

Gold and Silver Premier Club members will automatically get access to all parts of the programme, and all other RuneScape members can register their interest from next Wednesday. We intend to take a wide range in both player level and PC specifications and those chosen will be notified prior to the opening of the programme, and we’ll add more players as it progresses. If you don’t get in right away, don’t worry - all members will have a chance to try out the content and offer feedback before release.

[/quote]
They just say before release, which probably means they’ll do the free weekend thing. If you guys remember from the EoC beta you had to be a member for 12 continuous months to have access to it 24/7[/quote]
We’ll have to see, either way, I think it will look pretty good.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape 3
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

^ That is not 100% true… A lot of people look forward to improved and amazing graphics. Moving RuneScape to HTML5 will do so because using Java as a game engine, limits the definition of the graphics that can be added. As for the EoC, it made combat more realistic rather than just attacking with the same animation every time. How about this, you go and get a sword and try attacking something or someone with the same move every time, it will get boring very shortly. You need a variety of attacks and moves to counter and confuse your opponent. Yea, switching combat styles or weapons will do something, but for how long? Anyway, it’s not your company and if you don’t like the new combat, you can still go play the '07 server or not play at all, no one is forcing you to play. So quit bitching about the EoC already, it will not change anything.

Edit: As for Jagex supposedly taking ideas from WoW, you go try and make an original idea game that someone hasn’t thought of already. I guarantee you that it will be very hard, if even possible. Blizzard did not think of all of their ideas and people are giving too much credit to them.

Also, the BTS 46 video:

The last bit of the video that contained pictures of new Castle Wars look pretty good. I look forward to the Castle Wars update.

Read full topic
